Problem:
Consider a system of complex functions where the input signal \\( x(t) \\) is transformed by a linear operator to produce an output \\( y(t) = L[x(t)] \\) described by the integral transformation \\( L[x(t)] = \\int_{-\\infty}^{\\infty} k(t, s) x(s) ds \\), where \\( k(t, s) \\) is the kernel of the transformation.

If the kernel is altered at time \\( t_1 \\) to a new kernel \\( k'(t, s) \\), will the output at time \\( t > t_1 \\) be independent of previous kernel \\( k(t, s) \\)?
Explanation: The output at any time point depends on both the input signal and the kernel applied up to that time. Changes to the kernel at \\( t_1 \\) do not negate the effects of the original kernel on the signal processed before \\( t_1 \\), and the resulting output will reflect the cumulative effect of both kernels applied over time.
